summary: This module handles low‑level audio preprocessing using the PyAV library. It reads audio data from binary streams, decodes it into raw frames, normalizes and resamples the signal to a target sample rate, and provides utilities for trimming or padding the waveform to a desired length. The implementation abstracts away FFmpeg dependencies, offering a self‑contained solution for preparing audio input for downstream speech‑to‑text models.
business_intent: Enable reliable, dependency‑free extraction and conditioning of audio signals so that speech recognition pipelines can operate on uniformly sampled and correctly sized waveforms.
